page.title: 09SOUTH TYNESIDE COLLEGE
page.content: In the middle of the 19th century Doctor Thomas Winterbottom sailed to and forth from Africa. There was often trouble on these voyages,so when Doctor Winterbottom retired to South Shields he set up a marine school with some of his own money.This school was the first in the world and it became world famous. Around 1950 Doctor Winterbottom's money began to run out,so the local authority bought the school.At Westoe Village there was a pig farm called Colleys. This farm was the site for the new Marine Technical College as it was called then.The Duke of Edinburgh opened it in 1954.Today there are 6000 students who come from all over the world.The college has nine depts.and is open 5 days weekly. In 1984 the college merged with Hebburn Technical College and was renamed South Tyneside College.
